lexeme.note: Old Irish: eclais. itself borrowed from Greek 'ἐκκλησία' ('ekklēsia'), 'ἐκκλησίας' (an assembly, a congregation, a church - First Declension Feminine Noun). From ἔκκλητος "summoned", from 'ἐκκαλέω' (I summon), from 'ἐκ' (out - cognate with 'á', 'eas-') and 'καλέω' (I call - cognate with 'coileach' - rooster).
Listed in An Seotal: Religious and Moral, as 'church'.
